title: Understanding PivotTable Fields
text: PivotTables are powerful tools in data analysis. They help summarize and analyze data efficiently. To create a PivotTable, you need to understand its two main fields.

title: Data Field
text: The data field in a PivotTable contains the values that you want to summarize. This could be sales figures, quantities, or any other numerical data.

title: Category Field
text: The category field describes the data by categorizing it. This could be product names, regions, or any other categorical data that helps in organizing the data field.

hintAnswer: data, which contains values that PivotTable will summarize, and category, which describes the data by categorizing it
title: Identifying the Fields
text: Now that you understand the two fields, identify which one contains the values to be summarized and which one categorizes the data.
choices: data, which contains values that PivotTable will summarize, and category, which describes the data by categorizing it
category, which contains values that PivotTable will summarize, and data, which describes the data by categorizing it
data, which contains objects, and categories, which contains characters
data, which contains special characters and numeric, and categories, which contains characters
